@wu-sheng, before reading your suggestions I came up with `spring-with-request-method-op-name-scenario`. How does that sound? I've pushed that here: https://github.com/SkyAPMTest/agent-auto-integration-testcases/pull/55

Also, an unforeseen side effect with the way the `PathMappingCache` works (I believe) is that I ended up with endpoint names like:
 - `/requestmethod/{GET}/acceptGetExplicit`
 - `/requestmethod/{GET,HEAD,POST,PUT,PATCH,DELETE,OPTIONS,TRACE}/acceptAllExplicit`

I think these might be a bit confusing. Suggestions?
I think we should put the `get` at the first part. `/{GET}/requestmethod/acceptGetExplicit` should make more sense. Agree?
For test case name, I think yours should be good.

OK, if you have any issue, let us know. That part sometimes is harder than plugin itself.  We even have some pr closed because of test case work failure. So if you need, ask for helps to me and @ascrutae
If you are using ElasticSearch, `matchPhraseQuery` will separate words by `/`. So this endpoint will be matched.

`More than {} spans required to create` happens in two case.
1. The normal one, you create too many span(300 by default) in one request, so the agent core will ignore others.
1. The unnormal one, one(or more) of you plugin doesn't work well. One may create span, but don't close it right. So, the trace context can't be finished. You need to dig more about the plugin you are using.

I think you are facing (2)

This log means, you somehow run oap in cluster mode, but cluster module implementor can't find the cluster inform. The reason is based on which cluster implementor, and whether is it compatible with its server side? Such as Zookeeper auth.

I am flighting to SF today. 😄

@wu-sheng, luck you :P. That's okay though. I'm sure this isn't ready yet. I wanted to ask you if I was doing the `EntrySpan`/`ExitSpan` pattern correctly for the event bus.

Basically, when you send a message through the event bus it could be going to another computer or it could be going to a consumer on the same computer. So there is a chance that it could be a message which is sent on the same-thread, cross-thread, or cross-process. My question is:
 - should I be detecting if the message was same-thread, cross-thread, or cross-process and build the appropriate span based on that?

Should I have logic like:
```
If it was sent cross-thread:
 - Ignore ContextCarrier and work with ContextSnapshot

If it was sent cross-process
 - Use ContextCarrier
```

Currently sending a message always creates an `ExitSpan` and sends the `ContextCarrier` and receiving a message always creates a `EntrySpan` using the `ContextCarrier` sent.
Auth? It seems never used in my skywalking environment.

@wu-sheng @peng-yongsheng 
Hello, two friends. I have adjusted the unreasonable code before, and I hope you can spare some time to give me some advice. Thank you very much    ：）

Hi, Peng

I hope you have time to review, I flight to SF today. Can't do review in next nearly two days.

> works for macOS. Which os do you use to build the image?
> By the way you don't need to build this by yourself more than pull the image from Dockerhub.

CentOs 

The storage is default h2 in the image from Dockerhub. I want to change it to ES, so I must buid it by myself
I don't it is related to auth or not. But im theory, your cluster module doesn't work well.

> @klboke As far as I know, Elasticsearch security just support xPack library. So, is this PR just support Aliyun's Elasticsearch? If not, please provide us a document, let us know how to install a elasticsearch with security that can work together with this PR.

This pr is only compatible with ES services with HTTP Basic simple authentication, and does not change the default mode of services without authentication. The following items are some plugins provided by the community to do the HTTP Basic Simple Authentication for ES.
https://github.com/Asquera/elasticsearch-http-basic
https://github.com/elasticfence/elasticsearch-http-user-auth

> If this is just for ali cloud, which would make me concern too. For commercial service, we can't use its protocol as default or inbinding code.

It is not for ES of Alibaba Cloud. There are many applications for http basic authentication of ES. When it is necessary to provide access to the external network, this is an indispensable setting.
Could you provide an es document pointing to this protocol?

> Could you provide an es document pointing to this protocol?

Find some articles for http authentication processing for ES
https://brudtkuhl.com/blog/securing-elasticsearch/
https://www.rootopen.com/git/5b8ba94964fec049aff8b911
http://guoze.me/2015/05/28/elasticsearch-http-basic-authentication/
OK, got it, preciate for your contribution.

@wu-sheng Supplement the use of the BestQualLevelClient with basic authentication authentication, just to be compatible with those ES services that do http basic authentication, not just provide ES services connected to Alibaba Cloud.

From the materials you provided, now my concern is more about misguiding users. When people notice there is auth support in skywalking, they are thinking about xpack, but, actually, we need deploy a proxy to do auth in un-official way. For official, I mean in es official document.

Also, the project document has nothing related to this deployment of proxy.

I prefer this should be introduced as a blog, rather than core inbinding source codes.

@peng-yongsheng What do you think?

> From the materials you provided, now my concern is more about misguiding users. When people notice there is auth support in skywalking, they are thinking about xpack, but, actually, we need deploy a proxy to do auth in un-official way. For official, I mean in es official document.
> 
> Also, the project document has nothing related to this deployment of proxy.
> 
> I prefer this should be introduced as a blog, rather than core inbinding source codes.
> 
> @peng-yongsheng What do you think?

By default, this configuration is not enabled. There should be no navigation. I think I should not lose this part of the user who uses the Http Basic authentication service. I will add this blog.
@wu-sheng My concern is same as your's. The user's first thought is this auth is work with Xpack. But actually not. So, we must explain it to the user over and over again.

@klboke I am not arguing for the default values or optional. I am saying, we are going to introduce am unofficial way to our community. This is the core issue I want to be 100% clear and supported by maintainers.

Also, because it is unofficial, the maintainer team has to explain how to use it, especially when people asked why are we doing this. This becomes a question hard to answer.
@JaredTan95 thoughts?
Http Basic authentication is just a common regular authentication method, not an exclusive authentication mode of Xpack. These two are not necessarily related.

Let's wait and see whether others, especially committers, would support this. Since now, we have concerns from two ppmc members for futher support in community.

As a global and widely used oss project, we have to be carefully about this kind of un-official feature.

> @JaredTan95 thoughts?

I got this point mostly, this is a common HTTP authentication and also works in Xpack security. @klboke So, We need documents or a blog related and post in [swywalking website](https://github.com/apache/incubator-skywalking-website) to explain it.
Could this work with xpack elasticsearch server?

> Could this work with xpack elasticsearch server?

Xpack elasticsearch server also provides Http Basic authentication, this pr is only for Http Basic authentication connection
Good, if this works for es xpack, really ease my concern. Then I suggest you write the basic auth support document in es storage section. I think it will make people easier yo understand.

> Good, if this works for es xpack, really ease my concern. Then I suggest you write the basic auth support document in es storage section. I think it will make people easier yo understand.

Http Basic authentication is a regular authentication method. As this article says https://brudtkuhl.com/blog/securing-elasticsearch/, there are various ways to implement Http Basic, such as plugins, Nginx agents, etc., it should be very good. Understand it. The blog explains this piece, I am also preparing
I am thinking more about xpack support. And for document, skywalking official document needs to explain more.
The key for pr ready to be merged is, we need make sure es xpack could auth when user active tgis feature. I think Peng has asked once to provide steps to verify.

> The key for pr ready to be merged is, we need make sure es xpack could auth when user active tgis feature. I think Peng has asked once to provide steps to verify.

Maybe I started to say that Ali's ES service is a bit wrong. This PR has nothing to do with xpack elasticsearch. It only provides a connection compatible with Http Basic authentication. The current RestHighLevelClient is based on Apache httpClient, and Http Basic is also supported by httpClient.
No matter ali cloud or not, inbinding feature requests for the key I mentioned. You need to work with official es API.

> No matter ali cloud or not, inbinding feature requests for the key I mentioned. You need to work with official es API.

https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/client/java-rest/6.6/_basic_authentication.html#_basic_authentication
Yes. This is the key to let this pr in.😊
